results.name: Triangle, read by rows, where T(n,k) = Sum_{j=0..n-k-1} C(j+k,j)*T(n-1,j+k) for n>k>=0 with T(n,n)=1.
comment: Column 0 equals row sums (A026898) shift right.

T(n,k) is the number of m-tuples of nonnegative integers satisfying these two criteria: (i) there are exactly k 0’s, and (ii) the remaining m-k elements are positive integers less than or equal to n-m. - _Mathew Englander_, Feb 25 2021
link: Muniru A Asiru, Rows n=0..150 of triangle, flattened
formula: G.f.: A(x,y) = Sum_{n>=0} Sum_{k>=0} x^(n+k)*y^k / (1 - n*x)^(k+1). - _Paul D. Hanna_, Mar 06 2013
Antidiagonal sums: Sum_{j = 0..n} Sum_{i = j..floor((n+j)/2)} binomial(i,j)*(n+j-2*i)^j. (End)
